author: rooneg
msg: Fix for issue 2576: Don't lock the base folder twice when committing
overlapping targets non-recursively.
Patch by: lgo
* subversion/libsvn_client/commit.c
(svn_client_commit3): Add extra checks to avoid adding the base folder
to dirs_to_lock.  Catch a potential stack overflow on Windows in a
"this should not happen" situation, abort() instead.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/commit_tests.py
(commit_same_folder_in_targets): New test
(test_list): Run the new commit test.

author: dlr
msg: On the merge-tracking branch: Refactor directory/multi-file 'merge'
implementation in preparation for handing of reverts, and single-file
merges.
* subversion/libsvn_client/diff.c
(calculate_merge_ranges): Add an IS_REVERT parameter, and stub out
possible handling in the function body.
(update_wc_merge_info): New function factored out of tail end of
do_merge() (planned for use in do_single_file_merge()).  Calculates
the new merge info for REL_PATH based on TARGET_MERGEINFO and
RANGES, and record it in the WC at TARGET_WCPATH.
(do_merge): Remove local "orig_mergeinfo" variable in favor of
operating on the target's (original) merge info directly in
update_wc_merge_info(), and adjust code accordingly.  Add local
"is_revert" flag.

author: dlr
msg: On the merge-tracking branch: A follow-up to r20261.
* subversion/libsvn_client/diff.c
(do_merge): Use the correct start revision when calling
reporter->set_path() for multi-range merges, and note that reverts
aren't yet handled correctly.

author: dlr
msg: On the merge-tracking branch: Improve the doc string and
implementation for a helper function used by the 'merge' operation.
* subversion/libsvn_client/diff.c
(calculate_merge_ranges): Document assumption about
TARGET_MERGEINFO.  Simplify implementation based on that
assumption.

author: dlr
msg: On the merge-tracking branch: Improve doc string.
* subversion/include/svn_mergeinfo.h
(svn_mergeinfo_parse): Mention that this function never returns NULL
(only an empty hash).
